entry.title: Chile volcano ash cloud reaches Brazil, flights cancelled
Chile Volcano Prompts New Evacuations, Flights to Argentina Cancelled
entry.summary: Television images showed residents in a town close to Lake Chapo quickly driving down ash-laden streets away from the smoldering volcano.

entry.title: Chile volcano prompts new evacuations, flights to Argentina canceled
entry.summary: Some houses and schools located close to the volcano have collapsed under the weight of the ash.

entry.title: Chile volcano prompts new evacuations, flights to Argentina canceled
entry.summary: Most of the mines in top copper exporter Chile are located in the north of the country, far from the volcano.

entry.title: Flights canceled as ash cloud pours from Chile volcano
entry.summary:
In 2011, the eruption of Chile's Puyehue volcano sent ash high into the atmosphere, leading to flight cancellations as far away as Australia.

Nearly 4,500 people have been evacuated from the immediate area, authorities said, with the emergency services focusing on the small town of Ensenada, some 15 kilometers from the volcano.

entry.title: Flights canceled as ash cloud pours from Chile volcano
Ash piles up from eruption of Chile's Calbuco volcano
entry.summary: A woman holds a mask to her face as she stands with her belongings before evacuating the town of Ensenada, Chile after the Calbuco volcano erupted, Thursday, April 23, 2015.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary: Men remove ash from a building's roof, left by the Calbuco volcano, in Ensenada, Chile, Thursday, April 23, 2015.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary: A bus drives along an ash covered road, caused by the eruption of Chile's Calbuco volcano in Villa La Angostura, in southern Argentina, Thursday, April 23, 2015.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary: As the ash cloud spread, "people went into a state of panic," said Miguel Silva Diaz, 28, an engineer who lives in Puerto Montt, a city about 14 miles (22 kilometers) from the volcano.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew in Chile; concerns mount as ash spreads across the region
entry.summary: The volcano erupted Wednesday afternoon for the first time in more than four decades, sending a towering plume of ash more than 6 miles (10 kilometers) into the air.

entry.title: Incredible images from volcano erupting in Chile
entry.summary: Twin blasts from the Calbuco volcano in southern Chile have sent vast clouds of ash into the sky, increasing concerns that it could contaminate water, cause respiratory illnesses and ground more flights.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary:
President Michelle Bachelet declared a state of emergency, saying the eruption of Calbuco is "more serious and unpredictable" than the one last month at the Villarica volcano, which also forced the evacuation of thousands.

In 2011, a volcano in the Caulle Cordon of southern Chile erupted violently, forcing the cancellation of hundreds of flights and the evacuation of more than 3,500 people.

entry.title: Volcano Calbuco still erupting in Chile, some flights cancelled [Video]
entry.summary: SANTIAGO - Volcano Calbuco in southern Chile that erupted unexpectedly on Wednesday was still pouring ash into the sky on Thursday, forcing the cancellation of flights from nearby towns in both Chile and neighbouring Argentina.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts anew; ash causing concern
entry.summary: Authorities have evacuated 4,000 people and closed access to the area around the volcano, which lies near the cities of Puerto Varas and Puerto Montt, some 1,000 kilometers (620 miles) south of Santiago.

entry.title: Chile volcano erupts for first time in decades
entry.summary: Smoke and ash rise from the Calbuco volcano as seen from the city of Puerto Montt, April 22, 2015.

entry.title: Thousands evacuate after Chile volcano erupts
entry.summary: He urged residents to evacuate and warned of possible lahars, a mix of water and rock fragments that flow down a volcano's slopes and river valleys.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts in Chile, and nearby town evacuated
entry.summary: Authorities ordered an evacuation for a six-mile radius around the volcano, which is the second in southern Chile to have a substantial eruption since March 3, when the Villarrica volcano emitted a brief but fiery burst of ash and lava.

entry.title: Chile declares emergency as Calbuco volcano erupts
entry.summary: Southern Chile's Calbuco volcano erupted on Wednesday for the first time in nearly half a century, spewing a giant funnel of ash high into the sky and prompting authorities to declare a state of emergency.

entry.title: Town evacuated in Chile as volcano erupts
entry.summary: Trevor Moffat, who lives in Ensenada, some 10 km from the volcano, said he and his family fled when the volcano erupted.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts in Chile, and nearby town evacuated
entry.summary: The Calbuco volcano erupts near Puerto Varas, Chile, Wednesday, April 22, 2015.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts in Chile, and nearby town evacuated
entry.summary: SANTIAGO, Chile (AP) - The Calbuco volcano erupted Wednesday for the first time in more than 42 years, billowing a huge ash cloud over a sparsely populated, mountainous area in southern Chile.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts in southern Chile for first time since 1972; nearby town evacuated
entry.summary: The National Mining and Geology Service has issued a high alert, barring access to the mountainous area around the volcano in southern Chile.

entry.title: Calbuco Volcano Erupts in Chile, and Nearby Town Evacuated
entry.summary: The Calbuco volcano erupted Wednesday for the first time in more than 42 years, and Chilean authorities ordered the evacuation of the few thousand people living in a town a few miles away.

entry.title: Calbuco volcano erupts in Chile, and nearby town evacuated
Volcano erupts in Chile
entry.summary: Volcano Calbuco erupted on Wednesday in southern Chile, sending a plume of ash and smoke several miles up into the sky, local television images showed.

entry.title: 'Volcano of Fire' spews colossal column of ash over Mexican city
entry.summary: Mexico's Colima volcano has spewed a giant 3.5-kilometre-high column of ash that rained down on a nearby city, authorities say.

entry.title: Costa Rican Airport Reopens After Volcano Eruption
entry.summary: Smoke and ash spewing high into the sky from the Turrialba volcano led officials to cancel classes in a dozen nearby schools Friday and disrupted operations at Costa Rica's principal airport.

entry.title: Costa Rican airport reopens after volcano eruption
Costa Rica reopens capital airport after volcano eruption
entry.summary: The Turrialba volcano erupted three times Thursday and state observers recorded a smaller eruption Friday morning.

entry.title: Chile volcano sends spectacular pillar of fire into night sky (VIDEO)
entry.summary: Juan Carlos Rojas, head of air transit at the government's civil aeronautics division, said that ash from the volcano was well under flight paths used by commercial airliners.

entry.title: Thousands evacuated after volcano erupts in southern Chile
entry.summary: SANTIAGO - Volcano Villarrica in southern Chile went quiet on Tuesday after an eruption that sent a plume of ash and lava high into the sky in the early hours put Chile on high alert.

entry.title: Thousands flee after volcano erupts in Chile
entry.summary: Tourists flock to the area around Villarrica for outdoor activities like kayaking, horseback riding, fishing and hiking around the volcano, which last had a major eruption in 1984.

entry.title: Villages evacuated as Volcano Villarrica erupts in southern Chile
entry.summary: Southern Chile's Volcano Villarrica has erupted, sending a plume of ash and lava high into the sky, and forcing the evacuation of nearby communities.

entry.title: Villarica volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary:
Local media showed images of the volcano bursting at the top, glowing in the dark amid heavy smoke and rivers of lava.

The eruption "was something beautiful and amazing. We're still a bit shocked but the volcano has calmed down so I'm going to continue with my vacation," Alejandra Paz Bustos, 29, said as she sunbathed at nearby lake Villarrica.

Officials said late Tuesday that about 15,000 people living in rural areas near the volcano were suffering water shortages after the eruption, and kept the red alert for nearby areas.

entry.title: Volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary:
"I've never seen a volcano erupt and it was spewing lava and ash hundreds of meters into the air. Lightning was striking down at the volcano from the ash cloud that formed from the eruption."

Chilean authorities had issued an orange alert on Monday because of increased activity at the volcano.

entry.title: Volcano in southern Chile erupts, thousands evacuated
entry.summary: The Villarica volcano erupted Tuesday around 3 a.m. local time, according to the National Emergency Office, which issued a red alert and ordered evacuations.

entry.title: Volcano erupts in southern Chile
VIDEO: Volcano eruption puts Chile on alert
Volcano Villarrica erupts in southern Chile, villages evacuated
entry.summary: The Villarica volcano erupts near Pucon, Chile, early Tuesday, March 3, 2015.
